results.title: Atenolol versus the fixed combination of atenolol and nifedipine in stable angina pectoris.
results.text_hl: Exercise stress testing (Bruce protocol) at the end of each treatment period demonstrated that the time to the onset of @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ and occurrence of 1 mm ST segment @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ improved significantly (P < 0.05 and P < 0.001 respectively) whilst on the fixed combination compared to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ alone.

citations.NLM: Foale RA. Atenolol versus the fixed combination of atenolol and nifedipine in stable angina pectoris. Eur Heart J. 1993 Oct;14(10):1369-74. PMID: 8262084

results.title: Ischemic pain relief in patients with acute myocardial infarction by intravenous atenolol.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@Ischemic pain@@@ relief in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@acute myocardial infarction@@@ by intravenous @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

results.title: Atenolol with and without nifedipine in the treatment of angina pectoris. Preliminary report.
results.text_hl: There was a substantial improvement in the number of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ rendered @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ free: 29% on @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and 42% on combination.

results.title: Comparison of the efficacy of atenolol and its combination with slow-release nifedipine in chronic stable angina.
results.text_hl: Twice as many @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ experienced @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ later with the combination treatment than with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ alone.

results.title: [The effect of antihypertensive drugs on the anaesthetic effect of lidocaine in hypertensive patients who need dental treatment].
results.journal: Rev Med Chir Soc Med Nat Iasi
results.text_hl: Our data demonstrated a significant decrease of @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ intensity in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@/@CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@.

results.title: Monotherapy with nifedipine GITS compared with atenolol in stable angina pectoris. The Working Group on Cardiovascular Research (WCN).
results.text_hl: At 4 weeks, there was no significant difference between nifedipine GITS 60 mg o.d. and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 100 mg o.d., in respect of improved time to onset of 0.1 mV @DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST-segment@@@ @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@, time to onset of @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@, and total exercise time.

citations.NLM: de Vries RJ, Dunselman PH. Monotherapy with nifedipine GITS compared with atenolol in stable angina pectoris. The Working Group on Cardiovascular Research (WCN). Br J Clin Pract Suppl. 1997 Apr;88():6-9. PMID: 9519501

results.title: A single-blind, placebo-controlled study of effects of atenolol on transient ischemia in "mixed" angina.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@Painful@@@ and painless episodes were decreased by a similar extent.

results.title: Medical treatment of patients with severe exertional and rest angina: double blind comparison of beta blocker, calcium antagonist, and nitrate.
results.text_hl: When nocturnal @DISEASE_ST_Elevation_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D000072657 @@@ST segment@@@ changes occurred, their frequency was reduced with all three drugs. @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@Pain@@@ was abolished in four @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ on @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D010146 @@@pain@@@ relief was significantly better on @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ than on @CHEMICAL_isosorbide_5_mononitrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:C030397 @@@isosorbide mononitrate@@@.

citations.NLM: Quyyumi AA, Crake T, Wright CM, Mockus LJ, Fox KM. Medical treatment of patients with severe exertional and rest angina: double blind comparison of beta blocker, calcium antagonist, and nitrate. Br Heart J. 1987 Jun;57(6):505-11. PMID: 3304367
